entry.title: [infra] Move targets node type declarations into an internal subdir.
entry.content:
The targets lib is becoming quite complicated, with future changes sure

to add additional complexity. To try and make it clearer to understand,

it will be reorganized into multiple files. This change moves the node

type declarations to their own file since they will be needed by nearly

every subset of the targets lib.



The following changes are being made to the node type declarations as

part of this:

* The kinds of the nodes have been updated to introduce a rudimentary

namespace (all the kinds start with "targets|").

* The documentation about the node types has been moved into README.md,

which allows for formatting and linking.

entry.title: Fix overly restrictive preferred device code
entry.content:
Without a "ForceWebXRRuntime" selection set, we were still only adding

one of the Cardboard or OpenXR providers at a time. However, if the

provider can't provide a runtime, we still need th other runtime. The

actual prioritiazation of runtimes happens in XrRuntimeManagerImpl;

though there is a slight optimization benefit to only including a

runtime if it has a chance to be used here.



This is a quick fix for the issue, a future change will look at

moving some of this logic into the XrRuntimeManagerImpl.

entry.title: variations: Use an experiment builder in field_trial_util_unittest
entry.content:
Currently, the field_trial_util unittests construct the

FieldTrialTestingExperiment struct in place. This is suboptimal

because it's often not clear from the code what the parameters are

and adding a new field to FieldTrialTestingExperiment requires

updating every test.



Fortunately, FieldTrialTestingExperiment is sparsely populated in

all of the tests and most fields can be left as their defaults. This

CL cleans up field_trial_util_unittest by adding a builder class

that lets us more explicitly construct FieldTrialTestingExperiment.

entry.title: Don't filter out private IPv6 networks for WebRTC
entry.content:
Right now when chromium is running inside IPv6 network with only private IPv6 address available (for example local IPv6 Wi-Fi network) it will filter it out. Because of this WebRTC won't be able to gather any ICE candidates in such networks, including STUN/TURN based candidates and won't be able to establish ICE connection.



After this change Chromium shouldn't filter out private (ULA https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unique_local_address) IPv6 addresses and WebRTC may expose them as ICE candidates.

contained a PIX indicator string "0014br.gov.bcb.pix".



This patch adds a PIX code format validator for the renderer to run

before returning a boolean result for "is PIX code found" to the

browser.

found PIX code passes the rudimentary validity checks.

entry.content:

removed from the device, addressed in crrev.com/c/5250142.

Or when Sync is reset from the dashboard (because then the cached

passphrase wouldn't be useful anymore). Addressed in this CL.

when sync is reset from the dashboard to clear the passphrase for a

specific account.

entry.title: Add WebUI warmup levels and under each level measure Tab Search startup time
entry.content:
Add an enum WebUIBubbleWarmUpLevel that describes the readiness levels

of the browser prior to showing a new WebUI bubble.



* kNoRenderer:

No render process is available. No pre-existing process, including

spare renderers, can be used or reused for this WebUI.

* kSpareRenderer:

Uses a spare render process for this WebUI.

* kDedicatedRenderer:

Uses a render process that already hosts other WebUIs prior to this

WebUI.

* kRedirectedWebContents:

Uses a WebContents that is initially on a different domain and

requires redirection to this WebUI.

This is not currently used anywhere, but worth further investigation.

* kNavigatedWebContents:

Uses a WebContents that has already navigated to this WebUI.



Add histograms Tabs.TabSearch.TimeToShow.{WarmUpLevel} to record the

startup time of Tab Search under each level. These metrics are similar

to previous metrics but have finer granularity. Specifically,



* The existing WindowTimeToShowCachedWebView2 == kNavigatedWebContents

* The existing WindowTimeToShowUncachedWebView2 is equivalent to an

aggregation of kNoRenderer, kSpareRenderer and kDedicatedRenderer.



These histogram will help us find the warm-up level that strikes the

right balance between latency and memory overhead in an effort to

improve WebUI startup time.

entry.title: Fold PaintInternalFragment() into TextPainter::Paint()
entry.content:
The PaintInternalFragment() variant is a single call

to GraphicsContext::DrawEmphasisMarks() so the "abstraction" doesn't

carry much weight. Folding PaintInternalFragment() into Paint() yields a

function of roughly the same number of source lines but a net reduction

in LoC. Move the reporting/metadata bits to be called last since the

relative order shouldn't matter - arguably this should be done a level

up in TextFragmentPainter though.



Bug: 1521809

entry.title: [fuchsia][i18n] Removes the remnants of ICU config-data
entry.content:
Removes the vestiges of ICU config-data support from ICU time zone

files resolution. New builds are only ever supposed to use the new

`/config/tzdata` capability for locating ICU time zone files in

the future.



As an added bonus, we made the tzdata provision mandatory. This

uncovered a few spots where proper routing was missing. So I added

those too.



Finally, added the "if this then that" lint to warn future us about

needed co-changes to paths.



NO_IFTTT=this change introduces the lint, no synced change necessary.

entry.title: Update background for folder view after updating focus
entry.content:
When updating the name of a folder, pressing the return key delegates to

the default controller's for the system texfield component. The

controller then updates the active state of the component but does not

updates the focused state. This is not desired for the app list item

view where the component does not have focus when it is not active.



After SystemTextfieldController handles the event, update focus on the

texfield.



When the folder header view loses focus, make sure that the name view's

background is correctly updated.



Bug: b:321829644

entry.title: [//media] Add DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECK on 1c upload w/ source legacy mailboxes
entry.content:
It is not possible for VideoFrames holding legacy mailboxes to reach

UploadVideoFrameToGLTexture(). The reason is the following:

* VideoFrames holding legacy mailboxes must have exactly one texture

* By definition, they are not using multiplanar SharedImages (since they

are not using SharedImage at all)

* This function only has two entrypoints: One from

CopyVideoFrameTexturesToGLTexture() that is conditional on the mailbox

either having more than one texture or holding a multiplanar

SharedImage, and one from CopyVideoFrameYUVDataToGLTexture(), which

itself is a codepath that is used only when the VideoFrame has no

textures.



Credit to vasilyt@, who made this point (with supporting links) here:



https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5266340/comment/91febb9b_3d5edfa8/



Bug: 40062791

Change-Id: I53a8128a99e8af1485d15c97b6c5c8217c042d28

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5272501

Reviewed-by: Frank Liberato

Reviewed-by: Vasiliy Telezhnikov

Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell

entry.content:
Create the new cache in the ResolveContext (alongside the old cache),

and if the kUseHostResolverCache Feature is enabled, store the

transaction results (including alias entries). Just handling the

success path for now. Cacheable errors will come in a subsequent CL.



Also remove HostCache::CreateDefaultCache() (which mostly just handled

deciding the max size), so the creation logic can be more consistent

between the two caches in the only place it ever happens anyway in

ResolveContext.

entry.title: Reland "Add the TabResourceUsageCollector to query for tab usage metrics"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 64c0f7371f2d179114938a98b1fe86576a65669e



Original CL was reverted due to TabResourceUsageCollectorBrowserTest.RefreshMemoryForOneWebContents flaking because the test's RunLoop wasn't terminating. This re-land fixes the test by passing in base::RunLoop::Type::kNestableTasksAllowed to the run loop and have the test navigate to a full URL so a full navigation occurs.



Original change's description:

> Add the TabResourceUsageCollector to query for tab usage metrics

>

> Introduces the TabResourceUsageCollector to handle immediate and

> periodic querying of tab resource usage data and updates the

> TabResourceUsageTabHelpers with the new data.

>

> Bug: 1506236

> Change-Id: I51891853c5727ba83f5632dfc4ddef63bb25e558

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5214772

> Commit-Queue: Steven Luong

> Reviewed-by: Joe Mason

entry.title: [//gpu] Correct IOSurfaceImageBackingFactory computation of using FBO
entry.content:
As a step toward the elimination of

SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_GLES2_FRAMEBUFFER_HINT, this CL changes

IOSurfaceImageBackingFactory to check whether its usages imply GLES2

write without relying on that bit (instead it checks for

GLES2_WRITE as well as (RASTER_WRITE | DISPLAY_WRITE) when Skia is

using GL). This is possible now that we have introduced GLES2_WRITE and

RASTER_WRITE and ensured that they are inserted in all of the proper

client-side SharedImage creation points.



To guard against unexpected functional issues, we make this change under

a killswitch.



Bug: 41491709

Change-Id: Id5c480bc76155240dd074b24bf3974e057b35862

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5272181

entry.title: [//gpu] Correct GLTextureImageBackingFactory computation of using FBO
entry.content:
As a step toward the elimination of

SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_GLES2_FRAMEBUFFER_HINT, this CL changes

GLTextureImageBackingFactory to check whether its usages imply GLES2

write without relying on that bit (instead it checks for

GLES2_WRITE | RASTER_WRITE | DISPLAY_WRITE). This is possible now that

we have introduced GLES2_WRITE and RASTER_WRITE and ensured that they

are inserted in all of the proper client-side SharedImage creation

points.



To guard against unexpected functional issues, we make this change under

a killswitch.

entry.title: [css-scroll-snap-2] Prioritize focused snap targets
entry.content:
An agreed upon proposal[1] by the CSS working group specifies that

where multiple scroll snap targets are visually equally aligned,

scroll containers should give priority to focused elements.

Blink did this for programmatic scrolls but not for user scrolls.

This patch prioritizes focused elements for both types of scrolls

by relying on a bit in SnapAreaData.



[1]https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9622



Bug: 1523819

entry.title: CSS Color: Use point symmetry
entry.content:
If the transfer function f is valid only for positive numbers, the let

g be the extended transfer function for all reals, defined as

g(x) = sign(x) * f(abs(x)).

entry.title: [iOS] Refactor app startup events for default browser promo.
entry.content:
Refactor app startup events for default browser promo into a new file

that will be the centralized place for all default browser promo signals.



In this CL I have removed ```LogBrowserIndirectlylaunched``` call from ```startupParametersForCommand``` because it is called only from ```startupParametersWithURL`` which already calls ```LogBrowserIndirectlylaunched``` for all cases.



In this CL I have also moved ```LogLikelyInterestedDefaultBrowserUserActivity(DefaultPromoTypeGeneral)``` to be recorded from ```LogWidgetKitAction``` because ```LogLikelyInterestedDefaultBrowserUserActivity(DefaultPromoTypeGeneral)``` is called in all the places that ```LogWidgetKitAction``` is called. That is for dino game and for all valid widget actions in ```startupParametersForCommand```.

entry.title: Add test that FF won't be created inside OOPSIF.
entry.content:
A fenced frame should refuse to create inside an isolated sandboxed

iframe (OOPSIF) since the latter does not support "allow-same-origin"

and fenced frames won't work without it. This CL adds a test to make

sure this is enforced.

entry.title: Reject BMP files with an incorrect BitmapOffset.
entry.content:
In the example file, the BitmapOffset is 0xFFFFFFFF but the file is

only about a hundred bytes long, and the image indicates that it

contains an embedded PNG. The BMPImageDecoder would invoke the

PNG image reader with this extremely-large offset, which caused an

overflow in the PNG reader's file-length guards; this led to a

subsequent CHECK-failure when reading past the end of the data.



(Be advised! Viewing the test BMP in Gerrit may "Aw, Snap" your

browser.)



Change-Id: If7442eac9ae13dcd3641a682f33fca590b87ed4c

entry.title: Lacros: Connect kProtectedContentDefault to Lacros browser pref.
entry.content:
Per our discussion in b/40915434 and the following doc:

go/lacros-protectedcontentdefault

kProtectedContentDefault is currently broken in Lacros.

chrome://settings page is connected to browser pref in Lacros,

while extension API connects chrome.privacy.protectedContentEnabled

to ash controlled pref. We have decided to migrate this pref

from ash-controlled pref to browser pref to make it consistent.

This cl change the extension API preference code to connect

chrome.privacy.protectedContentEnabled to the browser pref

in Lacros. This pref should no longer be ash-controlled anymore.



The prefrence_apitest.cc covers its test case in Lacros as

a browser pref in Lacros browser_tests. Removed the test from

lacros_chrome_browsertests since it will no longer be an

ash-controlled pref with this cl.

entry.content:
Before 57075df787d1241c8b703e3a0e3fde45964da861, Log.e() calls that had

a Throwable as the last parameter would be passed to both

String.format() and android.util.Log.e(). After the commit it is passed

only to android.util.Log.e().



This changes a log statement that was relying on the parameter to be

sent to both.

entry.title: Reland "[UNO] Change reconcilor behavior when user not signed in to chrome"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 3ba4805e4d5c68485cec63c5d5f835231d43089c



Original change's description:

> [UNO] Change reconcilor behavior when user not signed in to chrome

>

> This CL does the following:

> - Disables cookie updates/OAuthMultiLogin when the user is not signed in

> to chrome.

> - In the above mode, accounts in the cookie are the source of truth.

> Refresh tokens are updated to match the accounts in the cookie. If a

> refresh token doesn't have an account in the gaia cookie or the

> account is invalid (session expired) the refresh token is removed from

> chrome.

entry.title: Initial setup for QuicProxyDatagramClientSocket
entry.content:
QuicProxyDatagramClientSocket will be responsible for making a CONNECT-UDP request and will use a QUIC stream to send and receive datagrams. It will be used in QuicSessionPool::ProxyJob where it will either be built around a new QUIC stream in the session or a preexisting one will be used for a new QUIC session.



This CL adds the barebones (constructors, variables, and unimplemented methods) for the QuicProxyDatagramClientSocket.



Next steps:

- Mock testing

- Implement ConnectViaStream

- Implement BuildTunnelRequest

- Read/Write operations using stream



Bug: 1524411

entry.title: [GPU] Add and use HARDWARE_GRAPHITE GPU mode
entry.content:
The logic for GPU fallback currently doesn't take into account whether

Graphite is enabled. The logic works "accidentally" for platforms that

support fallback to software, because on repeated Graphite crashes the

mode will devolve from HARDWARE_{GL, VULKAN} to the software modes.



This CL makes this support explicit. It adds a new HARDWARE_GRAPHITE

mode and uses it as following:



* When Graphite is enabled, the initial mode is set as HARDWARE_GRAPHITE

* In that case, we do not fall back to Ganesh - instead, we fall back

directly to software

* When the GPU mode is not Graphite, we explicitly compute the

`grContextType` with Graphite disabled to ensure that the service

side does not see Graphite as enabled if Graphite is enabled but we

have fallen back from it



The last item is not strictly necessary as of this CL as we only fall

back from Graphite to software. However, it is conceptually correct

and sets the foundation for a followup CL that will introduce fallback

from Graphite to Ganesh-GL for platforms that don't support fallback to

software.



In this CL there is no functional change.



Followup CLs will do the following:

* Rework metrics to both take Graphite into account and give more

visibility on fallbacks overall

* Add Graphite->Ganesh-GL fallback on Android and ChromeOS

* Extend the GpuCrash_InfoForHardwareGpu test to verify fallback from

Graphite



Bug: 1507801

Change-Id: I098bfaebfaf5b7ad40dc2f6785047b8329dba7e4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5257657

Reviewed-by: Kyle Charbonneau

entry.title: Reland "ime/CharacterComposer: show preedit string in sequence mode"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 00e6672024727ed8a2127f5725f6c81db9d5703d.



The change caused a regression on ChromeOS, thus we now guard the

changes to be Linux-only. This change also keeps the original test case

and only changes the expectations for Linux, instead of deleting it

completely.



Original change's description:

> ime/CharacterComposer: show preedit string in sequence mode

>

> This patch updates CharacterComposer to show a preedit string in

> sequence mode; previously, a preedit string was only shown in hex mode.

>

> The rationale for this change is the following. The GTK IME, used by

> ozone/x11, shows a preedit string in sequence mode. By changing

> CharacterComposer's behaviour, this inconsistency between ozone/x11 and

> ozone/wayland (which uses CharacterComposer) is fixed.

>

> R=msisov@igalia.com

>

> Bug: 1257244

> Change-Id: Ibbc7d2d11810f4139b1c0461a42b294902643fc3

entry.title: Signed estimated_capture_clock_offset converted to unsigned parameter.
entry.content:
I got an estimated end to end audio latency that shows time travel.

I see in the log that we get an clock offset estimation that looks wrong



I found this in a log file

```

Unexpected latency value: 1706893657264 - (1706893656951 + 4294967295993 + -56.12744140625) = -4294967295623.873

```

The 4294967295993 is supposed to be clock offset estimation received from an absolute capture time header extension in milliseconds. (4294967295993 - 2^32*1000) = -7, which is a reasonable value for the clock offset, so it's likely there's a signed/unsigned issue somewhere.



i'm pretty sure, this fixes the problem. estimated_capture_clock_offset is signed, since the offset can be positive and negative. But UQ32x32ToInt64Ms have an unsigned parameter. We should use the signed version, i.e. Q32x32ToInt64Ms. 



Bug: b/324013062

Change-Id: I7d8b20b34bb7be63791a4cf4a8b990e20541e41c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5260103

Reviewed-by: Guido Urdaneta

entry.title: [AvatarButton] Encapuslate decision making into the delegate
entry.content:
The goal is to reduce the back and forth between the button and the

delegate, which creates a complex stack.

The button primarily takes care of the UI modifications, but gets

it's dynamic information from the delegate which is aware of Chrome

and Profile modifications.

This CL encapsulates those decisions more within the delegate to get a

clearer flow, it only reorders some calls, no behavior change is

expected





Potential future changes:

- Further decrease the coupling by having the delegate notify

the exact changes to be applied, instead of requesting the info

after calling `UpdateText()` again.

- Try to simplify the `Identity animation` flow.

- Cleanup the intercept text showing; make it more generic as a way

to enfornce a specific text controlled by some external

structure/logic. (next CL)



Bug: b:324018028

Change-Id: I7585e042c55f4b81a3453dbd27a733465192d5b3

entry.title: [iOS][Bookmark] Unify shortcut and in-browser bookmark’s snackbar.
entry.content:
When bookmarks are added from a iOS shortcut, the snack-bar will now:

* state the name of the folder in which the bookmark is saved, if it was set by the user previously.

* warns, when the user sync-bookmarks but those bookmarks is saved locally, that it won’t be synced.



It should be noted that strings are only changed in plural forms. In

singular form, the string remains the same. So using the same

screenshot is acceptable, as it only show singular. However, due to

presubmit that could not be overridden, this required to rename those

strings.



The only difference between the strings for the shortcuts and the

strings used in Chrome UI is that shortcuts show the number of added

bookmarks. The reason we don’t show this number in Chrome UI is that

if a bookmark folder is selected, we can’t know the number of

bookmarks in a synchronous fashion. Indeed, if the bookmark model is

deep, this number may take significant time to compute.



Fixed: 1518481

Change-Id: Ibfc46bd737b3a68e2cffb1f00c840c55992789a2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5237104

Reviewed-by: Tanmoy Mollik

Commit-Queue: Arthur Milchior

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1256688}

entry.title: Fix unhandled exception in FirstNonCapturedType.
entry.content:
We recently enabled the feature kAutofillUploadVotesForFieldsWithEmail

in Canary, that includes email votes on fields where the content matches

a valid email format, even if the address isn't already saved in any of

the user profiles.



This change caused an issue in the "FirstNonCapturedType" code section,

which previously assumed all filled field types would match an existing

(non-empty) type in the user's stored addresses. This led to a crash

(see linked bug).



This CL adds an exception for EMAIL_ADDRESS field types in

FirstNonCapturedType.



Fixed: b/41497271

Change-Id: I168f7dcb491338ba4f2cac1d810a49379c02750a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5268363

Commit-Queue: Norge Vizcay

Reviewed-by: Florian Leimgruber

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1256687}

entry.title: Decouple pending PDM query tracking
entry.content:
PDM::HasPendingQuery() indicates if it is currently waiting for the

result of some read request to the database. This CL splits this

function into HasPendingAddressQuery() and HasPendingPaymentsQuery().



It further splits PDM::is_data_loaded_ into is_address_data_loaded_ and

is_payments_data_loaded_. This bool is currently used to run

deduplication and emit metrics once the initial load has finished.

This CL decouples this logic and runs this logic once the initial

address/payments data load has finished.

To do so, LogStoredDataMetrics() is split into an address and a payments

function.



Decoupling this logic will make it easier to split the PDM into an

address and a payments data manager.



Bug: b/322170538

Change-Id: I28b38e18057c93a10058e38277707a816f975017

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5268962

Reviewed-by: Jihad Hanna

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1256686}

entry.title: [mullhet] Merge kUsernameEntry and kPasswordEntry.
entry.content:
The reason to merge these to PopupItemIds is following: passwords

manual fallback is going to add password suggestions for unclassified

fields. We'll need a unified PopupItemId for such suggestions. Right

now, kUsernameEntry and kPasswordEntry don't have any functional

differences. That's why it makes sense to merge them into

kPasswordEntry.



This will also make them aligned with kAddressEntry and

kCreditCardEntry.

entry.content:

information from the browser process.
